org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.compatibility

Class JDBCDriverTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase

              • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.compatibility.JDBCDriverTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class JDBCDriverTest
extends AbstractCompatibilityTest
    A set of client driver compatibility tests.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JDBCDriverTest.T_CN
      Helper class capturing TypeCoercion logic.
      static class  JDBCDriverTest.TypeDescriptor
      Description of a legal datatype and the version of Derby where the datatype first appears.

      • DERBY_5449_PATTERN

        private static java.util.regex.Pattern DERBY_5449_PATTERN
        A pattern that matches the value returned by DatabaseMetaData.getDriverVersion() for the versions that suffer from DERBY-5449. That is, all version on the 10.8 branch up to 10.8.2.2.

        public void testDerby4888()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException

        java.sql.SQLException

      • testDerby5449

        public void testDerby5449()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Test case for DERBY-5449. Verify that PreparedStatement.setBoolean() works across different versions. Used to fail with a ClassCastException when talking to servers at version 10.7 and earlier.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkRows

        private void checkRows(java.sql.PreparedStatement ps,
                       JDBCDriverTest.TypeDescriptor[] types,
                       java.lang.Object[][] rows)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Verify that we select the values we originally inserted into a table, and that the valid coercions succeeds.
        Parameters:
        ps - the query used to obtain the results
        types - the type descriptions of the columns
        rows - the values expected to be returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkPlainGet

        private void checkPlainGet(java.sql.PreparedStatement ps,
                           int columnIndex,
                           JDBCDriverTest.TypeDescriptor type,
                           java.lang.Object[][] rows)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks that fetching the specified column as the declared data type works, i.e doing rs.getString() on a VARCHAR column or rs.getInt() on a SMALLINT column.
        Parameters:
        ps - the query used to obtain the results
        columnIndex - the index of the column to check
        type - the type description of the column
        rows - the values expected to be returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        java.sql.SQLException

      • suite

        public static junit.framework.Test suite()
        Returns a suite with all the available JDBC client driver compatibility tests.

        JUnit boilerplate which adds as test cases all public methods whose names start with the string "test" in the named classes.
